summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions on Somalia, 
Determining the situation in Somalia remains a threat to international peace and security,

Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter,

1. Authorises African Union Member States to maintain AMISOM deployment until 31 March 2022, 
to take necessary measures in compliance with international law, including humanitarian and human rights law, 
and respect Somalia's sovereignty, territorial integrity, and unity, to carry out its mandate as set out in resolution 2568 (2021);

2. Requests the Secretary-General to continue logistical support through UNSOS for UNSOM, 
AMISOM personnel and Somali security forces as set out in resolutions 2568 (2021) and 2245 (2015);

3. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
